title: [Large-Scale] Mobile Microlearning Expert Course for Designing and Improving Technical College Mathematics Curricula: Strengthening Computation, Formula, and Graph Utilization with Integrated Proof and Statistics Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced mathematical foundations (calculus, linear algebra, probability theory), basic understanding of curriculum design, symbolic reasoning proficiency, and foundational graph analysis skills
context.additional_context: For in-service professionals, requires establishing an efficient yet limited smartphone-based learning environment. Emphasis on techniques to simplify and deliver complex mathematical concepts (graph analysis, multivariable equations, probability distributions) in mobile contexts. Application of mobile-friendly approaches visualizing proof processes step-by-step.

learning_goals: Learners will improve their competency in designing technology college-tailored math curricula (including equation, probability, and statistics modules) and master proof process optimization techniques using learning design models and collective meaning-making methodologies

Acquiring the ability to develop 5-stage microlearning modules optimized for mobile environments (including calculation problem-solving, graph visualization, and formula application case studies) and strengthening statistical analysis and visualization skills

Cultivating the ability to propose flexible curriculum improvement plans through project-based assessments (such as problem-solving strategies, proof process optimization, and multivariable equation interpretation) and enhancing graph-based data interpretation skills

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
